metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6886 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An error within the "parse_tiff_ifd()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions before 0.18.2 can be exploited to corrupt memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6886` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.5-1
libraw19 - 0.18.5-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> All non-libraw packages listed here matched portions of the patch; an extensive analysis was not performed.

criterions.comment: darktable package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
kodi package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.5-1').
rawtherapee package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
